alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 7:01PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Floyd and southwestern Pike Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 701 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Virgie, or 9 miles south of Pikeville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Rockhouse, Lookout and Ashcamp around 710 PM EDT. Garden Village, Shelbiana and Chloe around 715 PM EDT. Elkhorn City, Marrowbone, Belcher and Cedarville around 720 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Fishtrap Lake, Biggs, Phyllis, Fedscreek, Mouthcard, Toonerville and Kimper. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern Kentucky.
